figure_1: Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from the clinically affected keratoconus eye of a patient from this study
figure_2: Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from the clinically unaffected eye (subclinical asymmetric keratoconus) fellow eye from the same patient shown in Figure 1.
figure_3: Representative Dual Scheimpflug/Placido image from a bilaterally normal topography and tomography eye of a patient from this study.
figure_4: Asphericity asymmetry Index (AAI) calculation. Adding the absolute value of the maximum positive elevation and the maximum negative depression values within the 6mm zone of the best fit toric aspheric (BFTA) posterior elevation map in 180ø opposite 45° zones, yields the AAI. In this example, AAI = +15 + (15) = 30.
